intro: Sphaeralcea capitata, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer, and its compact, globular shape. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Sphaeralcea capitata is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
